content.data: True and False Question with Multiple Sub-Questions
Make a Bond title by putting these four words in the correct order
Choose the correct answer for the following questions

There are twelve of us and my father doesn’t earn much money. It’s hard for my mother to feed them all. The fresh air on the moor makes them strong and healthy. Dickon is twelve and he’s always out on the moor. He loves animals.
When the wind blew the ivy to one side,
Mary found the door to the secret garden.
Mary found the key to the secret garden.
Mary saw Ben Weatherstaff looking at her.
As soon as Mary met Dickon,
she didn’t want to talk to him.
she was afraid of him and ran away.
they started to play ball together.
she liked him and trusted him.
Mr Craven returned home to Misselthwaite Manor
because he had to talk to Ben Weatherstaff.
because Mrs Medlock wrote him a letter.
because he dreamt about his wife’s garden.
could help him grow strong and healthy.
Select more that one options for the following question
Which of the following laws do not belong to Gestalt Phycology
Are the following sentences true (T) or false (F)?
True and False Question with Multiple Sub-Questions
Mary Lennox’s Indian nanny met her in London and they took the train to Yorkshire.
Mrs Medlock didn’t like Mary because she was bad-­‐tempered.
Mr Craven locked up his wife’s garden and kept the key in his pocket.
Martha worked as a housemaid at Misselthwaite Manor, but she lived on the moor with her family.
Drag and drop the textual descriptions to their correct locations within the model
Drag and drop the text to the correct location
Mary is a spoilt, unpleasant girl with a bad temper. When Mary meets Ben Weatherstaff, another unpleasant person, she tells him, ‘I’ve never had any friends.’ And Ben answers, ‘Neither have I.’
